title: flowSim Introduction
text: flowSim tool designed visualize, detect remove highly redundant information large FCM training sets, increasing performance ML algorithms reducing overfitting time decreasing computational time training. tool performs near duplicate image detection (NDD) combining community detection algorithms density analysis marker expression values.

title: flowSim Introduction
text: easiest way install flowSim directly github: user can also download package locally install package folder:

title: flowSim Introduction
text: input flowSim directory containing bivariate marker expression images analysis. particular, marker expression image must reported csv file whose first second column report expression , respectively, first second marker. ’s example correctly formatted csv file: Note: input csv contains two columns, columns ignored. example, csv files contain third column events membership, third column ignored.

what: Identification and removal of similar images
title: flowSim Introduction
text: two main functions consider flowSim package: V1 mode: get_similarity_all_plots() small datasets (< 500 files). V2 mode: get_similarity_all_plots_v2() large datasets. functions calculate pairwise distance matrix input files analysis. similar arguments, see help(get_similarity_all_plots_v2) help(get_similarity_all_plots) look list possible options. Note: get_similarity_all_plots_v2 designed used large datasets. https://github.com/semontante/flowSim_test_data contains large datasets test V2 mode flowSim. Based distance matrix, network nodes generated (node file analysis). community detection algorithm applied identify clusters similar files: user can optionally visualize network: final step filter similar files export final results (selected files cluster). user 3 options, possible: 1. get dataframe reporting names selected files group. 2. export bivariate plots selected files group. 3. export bivariate plots files groups. Note: directory (“fpath”“) can contain files even similarity analysis performed subset files (need generate subset directory). (2) (3) output directory contain folder group files.
code: # Get the directory path where the csv files are stored.  fpath <- system.file("extdata", package="flowSim")  # get similarity scores matrix for all files (V1 mode, < 500 files). library(parallel) library(sm) library(utils) out<-get_similarity_all_plots(path_dir = fpath)  # Alternatively, it is possible to feed the list of paths (only V1 mode). paths_plots<-list.files(path = fpath,full.names = TRUE) out<-get_similarity_all_plots(paths_plots = paths_plots)  # get similarity scores matrix for all files (V2 mode, > 500 files). library(parallel) library(sm) library(doSNOW) library(foreach) library(Rtsne) library(anocva) library(ggplot2) library(utils) library(stats) out<-get_similarity_all_plots_v2(path_dir = fpath)  # In both modes the user can provide the indices of the paths of the files to analyze.  # It is possible to get these indices by using a dedicated flowSim function  # or by using the user's own code.  inds_selected_files<-get_inds_files_selected(path_dir = fpath,                                               files_selected = files_to_analyze)   # Where files_to_analyze = vector of files names to analyze. out<-get_similarity_all_plots_v2(n_samples=inds_selected_files,path_dir = fpath)  # Analyze only 2nd and 3rd file path: based on list.files(fpath,full.names=TRUE) out<-get_similarity_all_plots_v2(n_samples=c(2,3),path_dir = fpath) # Execute igraph clustering. library(igraph) library(RColorBrewer) # louvain clustering (default). list_output<-gen_igraph_network(similarity_output = out,                                 method_clust = "louvain")  igraph_network<-list_output$igraph_network partition_vec<-list_output$partition # generate visnetwork. library(visNetwork) set.seed(1234) # set seed to get same groups colors. visnetdata<-gen_visnetwork_data(igraph_network) # heterogeneity score (optional). library(igraph) heterogeneity_score<-get_heterogeneity_score(igraph_network,partition_vec=partition_vec,                                              visnetdata = visnetdata) # plot full network library(visNetwork) plot_visnet(visnetdata) library(sm) library(parallel) library(igraph) library(visNetwork) library(RColorBrewer) library(utils) library(stats) library(Rtsne) library(ggplot2) library(doSNOW) library(foreach) library(anocva) library(graphics) # The directory, the files paths and the features dataset are needed.  fpath <- system.file("extdata", package="flowSim") paths_plots<-list.files(path = fpath,full.names = TRUE) df_features<-import_df_features(paths_plots = paths_plots)   # Execution of the similarity generation step, igraph grouping  # and the visnetwork generation step.   out<-get_similarity_all_plots(path_dir = fpath) list_output<-gen_igraph_network(similarity_output = out,                                 method_clust = "louvain")  igraph_network<-list_output$igraph_network partition_vec<-list_output$partition set.seed(1234) # set seed to get same groups colors. visnetdata<-gen_visnetwork_data(igraph_network)  # (1) get a dataframe reporting the names of the selected files for each group. info_exporting<-exports_filtered_plots(visnetdata = visnetdata,                                        df_features = df_features)  # (2) export the bivariate plots of selected files for each group.  df_features<-import_df_features(paths_plots = paths_plots)  info_exporting<-exports_filtered_plots(visnetdata = visnetdata,df_features = df_features,                                         path_expr_data = fpath,                                        path_output = "path/to/output_dir")     # Note: the output of V2 mode contains already the df_features. out<-get_similarity_all_plots_v2(path_dir = fpath) # V2 mode execution. info_exporting<-exports_filtered_plots(visnetdata = visnetdata,                                        df_features = out$df_features)    # (3) export the bivariate plots of all files of all groups. exports_plots(visnetdata = visnetdata,path_expr_data = fpath,                path_output = "path/to/output_dir")

title: flowSim Introduction
text: 3 different types network visualizations. user can visualize input files organized clusters isolated files (“full network visualization”): user can also visualize partial area network (“partial network visualization”). isolated files (black nodes) can also removed. particularly useful large networks. Finally, large networks (> 4000 files), possible plot full network . useful case plot contracted version network (“contracted network visualization”), node group edge proportional number connections groups. Note: visualizations options (like contracted network visualization) designed used large datasets. https://github.com/semontante/flowSim_test_data contains large datasets test complex flowSim visualization options.
code: library(visNetwork) # plot full network. plot_visnet(visnetdata) # plot full network setting the size of nodes. plot_visnet(visnetdata,size_nodes=25) # plot network without the isolated files. plot_visnet(visnetdata,remove_single_files = TRUE) # \donotrun. # plot only specific groups. plot_visnet(visnetdata,select_group = c("1")) # generate contracted data. visnetdata_contracted<-gen_visnetwork_data(igraph_network,contract_net = TRUE) # \donotrun. # plot contracted network. plot_visnet(visnetdata_contracted) # \donotrun.

what: Small vs large datasets, parameters tuning
title: flowSim Introduction
text: V1 algorithm designed work small datasets (< 500 files) also accurate version. several parameters user can set personalize similarity output. tolerance parameter influences number clusters estimated algorithm. lower tolerance threshold tends generate lower number clusters (intra-cluster differences tolerated), higher tolerance threshold tends generate clusters (intra-cluster differences less tolerated). default tolerance threshold V1 mode 0.6. also possible set number cores use: V2 algorithm designed work large datasets. faster, consumes less memory, also less accurate. parameters V1 additional parameter control level fragmentation dataset. fragmentation parameter increases, time execution memory load decreases, accuracy also decreases. 2000 files fragmentation parameter automatically estimated, 2000 files needs manually set. default tolerance threshold V2 algorithm 0.9. possible increase accuracy V2 algorithm, performing several cycles execution. cycle performed files selected previous cycle. way, residual homogeneity generated previous cycles progressively reduced. V1 mode V2 mode exporting step, can regulated filtering parameter. filtering parameter controls many files selected group. default value 2.1. decreasing parameter, number files selected group increases.
code: # Get the directory path where the csv files are stored. fpath <- system.file("extdata", package="flowSim") # get similarity scores matrix for all files (V1 mode, < 500 files).  # with default parameters. library(parallel) library(sm) library(utils) out<-get_similarity_all_plots(path_dir = fpath) # Set tolerance to 0.7. Default is 0.6.  out<-get_similarity_all_plots(path_dir = fpath, thr_score = 0.7) # Use 4 cores. out<-get_similarity_all_plots(path_dir = fpath, n_cores=4) # dataset broken in 5 fragments. out<-get_similarity_all_plots_v2(path_dir = fpath, n_batches = 5) # dataset broken in 100 fragments.  out<-get_similarity_all_plots_v2(path_dir = fpath, n_batches = 100) # Execution of flowSim in V2 mode. out<-get_similarity_all_plots_v2(path_dir = fpath)   list_output<-gen_igraph_network(similarity_output = out,method_clust = "louvain") igraph_network<-list_output$igraph_network partition_vec<-list_output$partition set.seed(1234) # to get same groups colors.  visnetdata<-gen_visnetwork_data(igraph_network) info_exporting<-exports_filtered_plots(visnetdata = visnetdata,                                        df_features = out$df_features)  # The selected files will be the files of the next cycle. files_new_cycle<-unlist(strsplit(info_exporting$files_filtered,";")) inds_selected_files<-get_inds_files_selected(path_dir = fpath,                                              files_selected = files_new_cycle)  # Execution of flowSim on the selected files of the previous cycles. out<-get_similarity_all_plots_v2(n_samples=inds_selected_files,                                  path_dir = fpath) # default threshold: 2.1 info_exporting<-exports_filtered_plots(visnetdata = visnetdata,df_features = df_features) # Filtering threshold set to 1.2. More patterns preserved. info_exporting<-exports_filtered_plots(visnetdata = visnetdata,df_features = df_features,                                        filter_thr=1.2)

Default NULL n_cores Number cores use. Default 1 type Default dens TODOLIST filter_thr float number indicating cut height dendrogram generated hierarchical clustering. Default 2.1 plot_dendrogram True, plot dendrogram generated (may fail groups). Default False. seed_n Set seed number. Default 40.
